title: ​Vive le roi? Meet France's king-in-waiting - but is the nation ready for a return to the monarchy?
text:
​Jean d'Orleans says he has the answers to France's problems - but, with three pretenders to the throne, is the nation ready for a return to the monarchy?

The man who would be king of France, Prince Jean d'Orléans, Count of Paris and heir to the Bourbon dynasty, lives in a chateau in Dreux, an hour from Paris.

A pretty town with a maze of twisting, narrow streets and squares, and a population of 31,000 (it is twinned with Evesham), Dreux has been a seat of the Orléans family since the 12th century. The first count of Dreux was Robert, the son of Louis VI, known as 'Louis the Fat', described in his genealogy as 'a great fighter, a great hunter, and a great eater', who by the age of 46 was too...
description: ​Jean d'Orleans says he has the answers to France's problems - but, with three pretenders to the throne, is the nation ready for a return to the monarchy?
